synthesis.page_description: The page is part of the Indico conference management system, specifically within the management section for a conference. The main content area displays general settings for a conference titled 'Conference' with details such as date, time, timezone, room, venue, and chairpersons. On the left sidebar is a navigation menu with several sections: Settings, Timetable, Protection, Privacy, Organisation (with sub-items like Materials, Contributions, Participant Roles), and Workflows. The 'Workflows' section is visible at the bottom of the sidebar but appears collapsed; its submenu items are not currently displayed.

assertion_checking.observation: To validate the assertion that after clicking on the 'Workflows' menu in the sidebar it has expanded and displays its submenu items (including an entry related to 'Call for Abstracts'), I would expect to see: 1) The 'Workflows' menu visually expanded (typically indicated by an open arrow or highlighted background), and 2) A list of submenu items beneath it—one of which should reference 'Call for Abstracts'.
assertion_checking.verification: In the screenshot provided, the 'Workflows' menu in the sidebar is visible but remains collapsed. There are no submenu items shown under it; specifically there is no visible entry related to 'Call for Abstracts'.

verdict.discrepancies: The expected state was that after clicking on 'Workflows', its submenu would be expanded and display entries including one related to 'Call for Abstracts'. However, in this screenshot, no expansion or submenu items are visible under 'Workflows', indicating that either it was not clicked or did not expand as intended.

results.test_name: 23::Conference Enable Notifications for Call for Abstracts

args.reason: Successfully entered the Conference's management area where workflow menus are available.
The sidebar menu labeled 'Workflows' was expanded, revealing an item called 'Call for Abstracts', as requested by the act query.
Successfully navigated to 'Call for Abstracts' under Workflows as requested.

The 'Enable module' button was clicked as requested. The subsequent screen appears blank, likely due to a reload or transition state typical after enabling a module. The act query's required action has been performed.
The task is complete: The 'Notifications' button in the Submission section under Call for Abstracts was clicked, and its configuration dialog appeared.

The task of clicking on the blue '+ Add new one' button inside the 'Configure e-mail notifications' modal dialog is complete, as evidenced by progression to the next step in adding a notification template.
The task to type 'Email' into the Title textbox in the modal has been successfully completed.
The '+ Add new rule' button was clicked and a new rule input row appeared, completing the assigned task.
The dropdown in the newly added rule row under Rules has been set to 'Submitted', completing the requested task.
The blue 'Save' button was clicked and a new email notification ruleset now appears in the configuration list, confirming successful completion of the task.

assertor_results.query: Verify that after clicking, the workflows menu expands and displays its contents including an item related to 'Call for Abstracts'.

synthesis.page_description: The page is part of the Indico conference management system, specifically within the 'Management - Settings - Conference' section. The left sidebar contains a navigation menu with several collapsible sections. The 'Workflows' section in the sidebar is expanded, showing its contents: 'Call for Abstracts', 'Peer Reviewing', and 'Editing'. Other sections such as 'Organisation', 'Room bookings', and others are also visible, but only their headers or collapsed states are shown. The main content area displays detailed information about a conference event, including title, date/time, room/venue details, chairpersons, additional info, keywords, and language settings.

assertion_checking.observation: After clicking on the workflows collapsible menu containing Call for Abstracts, I would expect to see the workflows menu expanded in the sidebar with its contents visible. Specifically, there should be an item related to 'Call for Abstracts' displayed under this menu.
assertion_checking.verification: The screenshot shows that the 'Workflows' section in the sidebar is indeed expanded. Its contents—'Call for Abstracts', 'Peer Reviewing', and 'Editing'—are clearly listed underneath it. The item related to 'Call for Abstracts' is present and visible.

assertor_results.query: Verify that after clicking, a new section or page related to Call for Abstracts is displayed in place of or above/below current content.

synthesis.page_description: The page is part of the Indico conference management system. The main content area displays a section titled 'Call for Abstracts' with a blue information box stating 'Call for Abstracts disabled.' There is an explanation about the module and an 'Enable module' button. The left sidebar contains navigation options, including Settings, Timetable, Protection, Privacy, Organisation (expanded to show sub-items), and Workflows (collapsed). At the top of the page are navigation links for Home, Create event, Room booking, Administration, and My profile. The breadcrumb at the top shows Home » Conference. The event title ('Conference 27 Aug - 10 Oct') and creator information are displayed above the main section.

assertion_checking.observation: After clicking the 'Call for Abstracts' link in the workflows menu, a new section or page specifically related to Call for Abstracts should be displayed in place of or above/below current content.
assertion_checking.verification: The main content area prominently displays a section titled 'Call for Abstracts,' with relevant information about enabling this module. This indicates that content specific to Call for Abstracts is now shown as the primary focus of the page.

assertor_results.query: Verify that after clicking, the blue information box about 'Call for Abstracts disabled' disappears or changes, and confirm that there are visible indicators (such as new buttons or sections) showing that Call for Abstracts is now enabled.

synthesis.page_description: The page is part of the Indico conference management system, specifically for managing the 'Call for Abstracts' section of a conference. At the top, there is a blue header with navigation options (Home, Create event, Room booking, Administration, My profile). The left sidebar contains various menu items under 'Organisation' and 'Workflows'. The main content area displays a heading for 'Call for Abstracts'. Below this heading is an orange information box stating: 'No email notifications templates are configured for this event. You can add the default templates using the button below and customize them, or use the "Notifications" dialog to set up custom notification templates.' There is a blue button labeled 'Setup default notifications' inside this box. Below that is another grey box indicating that 'The call for abstracts is not open yet', with options to schedule or start now. Several sections (Submission, Fields and types, Reviewing, Book of abstracts) are present but appear mostly disabled or inactive.

assertion_checking.observation: After clicking the Enable module button: 1) The blue information box about 'Call for Abstracts disabled' should disappear or change; 2) There should be visible indicators such as new buttons or sections showing that Call for Abstracts is now enabled.
assertion_checking.verification: The screenshot still shows an orange information box about email notifications not being configured (not specifically about Call for Abstracts being disabled). There is no explicit blue information box referencing Call for Abstracts being disabled. However, most controls in the main area remain greyed out/inactive except possibly the notification setup button and start/schedule buttons. There are no clear new indicators showing that Call for Abstracts has been enabled.

verdict.discrepancies: The expected change after enabling—removal/change of a disabling info box and appearance of active controls—has not occurred. The page still shows inactive/greyed-out sections and no clear sign that Call for Abstracts has been enabled.

assertor_results.query: Verify that a notifications configuration dialog or section appears, indicating options to configure or add notification templates.

synthesis.page_description: The page is part of the Indico conference management system, specifically within the 'Call for Abstracts' section for a conference. A modal dialog titled 'Configure e-mail notifications' is prominently displayed in the center of the screen. Inside this dialog, there is an informational message stating 'There are currently no e-mail templates.' Below this message, there is a blue button labeled '+ Add new one'. The rest of the page content is dimmed and not interactive while the modal dialog is open.

assertion_checking.observation: To validate the assertion, I would expect to see either a dialog or a section appear that allows configuration of notifications. This should include options or prompts to add or manage notification templates.
assertion_checking.verification: The screenshot shows a modal dialog titled 'Configure e-mail notifications', which contains an informational message about email templates and provides an '+ Add new one' button to add notification templates. This matches what would be expected for configuring or adding notification templates.

assertor_results.query: Verify that after clicking, a notification creation form appears within the modal or as a new dialog, allowing input for creating an email notification template.

synthesis.page_description: The page displays a modal dialog titled 'Add a new notification ruleset' in the center. The modal contains input fields for 'Title' and 'Email template', both marked as required. There is an area labeled 'Rules' with a message indicating that no rules have been added yet, and a button labeled 'Add new rule'. At the bottom of the modal are 'Save' and 'Cancel' buttons (with Save currently disabled). The background page is dimmed, indicating focus on the modal.

assertion_checking.observation: I would expect to see a form or dialog/modal appear after clicking the relevant button, containing input fields for creating an email notification template (such as title, email template selection, and rule configuration options).
assertion_checking.verification: A modal dialog titled 'Add a new notification ruleset' is visible. It contains input fields for Title and Email template, as well as an area to add rules. This matches what is expected for creating an email notification template.

assertor_results.query: Verify that the Title textbox in the 'Add a new notification ruleset' modal is currently focused and ready for input.

synthesis.page_description: The screenshot shows a modal dialog titled 'Add a new notification ruleset' overlaying the Indico conference management interface. The modal contains a form with two main fields at the top: 'Title' (marked as required with an asterisk) and 'Email template' (a dropdown currently set to 'Submit'). Below these fields is a section labeled 'Rules', which currently states that no rules have been added. There are buttons for 'Save', 'Cancel', and an action button labeled '+ Add new rule'. The background page is dimmed, indicating focus on the modal.

assertion_checking.observation: To validate the assertion, I would expect to see clear visual evidence that the Title textbox is focused. This typically appears as a blinking text cursor inside the textbox or a highlighted border around it, indicating readiness for input.
assertion_checking.verification: In the screenshot, the Title textbox has a blue border around it, which is commonly used to indicate focus in web forms. There is no visible blinking cursor due to the static nature of screenshots, but the blue border strongly suggests that this field is currently focused and ready for input.

verdict.discrepancies: No discrepancies observed that impact test intent. The absence of a blinking cursor is expected in screenshots and does not affect verification.

assertor_results.query: Verify that the Title textbox now contains exactly 'Email', indicating it has been entered as a unique notification title.

synthesis.page_description: The page displays a modal dialog titled 'Add a new notification ruleset' over the Indico conference management interface. Within the modal, there is a form with two required fields: 'Title' and 'Email template'. The 'Title' textbox contains the text 'Email'. Below this, there is an area for configuring rules, which currently states that no rules have been added. There are also 'Save' and 'Cancel' buttons at the bottom of the modal, along with an option to add a new rule.

assertion_checking.observation: To validate the assertion, I expect to see that the Title textbox contains exactly the text 'Email', indicating it has been entered as a unique notification title.
assertion_checking.verification: In the screenshot, the Title textbox in the modal dialog clearly contains exactly 'Email'.

assertor_results.query: Verify that after clicking, a section or form for configuring a new rule appears below or within the Rules area of the modal (e.g., fields or options related to event selection or conditions).

synthesis.page_description: The screenshot shows a modal dialog titled 'Add a new notification ruleset' overlaying the main Indico conference management interface. Within the modal, there are fields for entering a Title (currently filled with 'Email') and selecting an Email template (currently set to 'Submit'). Below these fields is a section labeled 'Rules'. In this section, there is explanatory text about when emails will be sent, followed by a dropdown menu labeled 'Select an option' and a trash icon (for deleting the rule). To the right of this area is a blue button labeled '+ Add new rule'. At the bottom of the modal are two buttons: 'Save' and 'Cancel'. The rest of the page in the background is dimmed.

assertion_checking.observation: After clicking the 'Add new rule' button, I would expect to see that a section or form for configuring a new rule appears below or within the Rules area. This should include fields or options related to event selection or conditions.
assertion_checking.verification: Within the Rules area of the modal, there is now an interactive row containing a dropdown menu ('Select an option') and a delete icon. This indicates that at least one rule configuration form/section has appeared as expected after clicking '+ Add new rule'.

assertor_results.query: Verify that in the Rules section of the modal, the event dropdown now displays 'Submitted' as its selected value.

synthesis.page_description: The page displays a modal dialog titled 'Add a new notification ruleset'. Within the modal, there are fields for 'Title' (set to 'Email') and 'Email template' (set to 'Submit'). Below these fields is a section labeled 'Rules'. In this section, there is a dropdown menu with the value 'Submitted' selected. Next to the dropdown is a trash icon for deleting the rule. At the bottom of the modal are two buttons: 'Save' and 'Cancel', as well as an option to add another rule ('Add new rule'). The background of the main page is dimmed, indicating focus on this modal.

assertion_checking.observation: In the Rules section of the modal, I expect to see an event dropdown with its selected value set to 'Submitted'.
assertion_checking.verification: The Rules section contains a dropdown menu that clearly displays 'Submitted' as its selected value.

assertor_results.query: Verify that after saving, either (a) a new notification titled 'Email' appears in the notifications configuration list or (b) there is an indication/confirmation that a new notification has been created and saved (such as success message or updated list).

synthesis.page_description: The page displays the 'Configure e-mail notifications' modal dialog over the 'Call for Abstracts' management section of a conference in Indico. The modal contains an informational text about how notifications work, and below it, there is a notification entry with the title 'Email'. This entry specifies that the email will be sent when the abstract is: Submitted. There are options to edit or delete this notification, as well as a button to show a preview. At the bottom right of the modal, there is an 'Add new one' button for adding additional notifications. The background shows various conference management options but is blurred and inactive due to the open modal.

assertion_checking.observation: After saving, I would expect to see either (a) a new notification titled 'Email' in the list of configured notifications or (b) some form of confirmation message indicating that a new notification has been created and saved.
assertion_checking.verification: In the screenshot, within the 'Configure e-mail notifications' modal, there is an entry titled 'Email', which matches what was entered in previous steps. It states that this email will be sent when an abstract is submitted. There is no explicit success message visible, but the presence of this newly created notification in the list fulfills condition (a) of the assertion.
